intro: Hieracium badiicolor, commonly known as the purple hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its striking purple to pinkish-red flowers, which are typically clustered in a flat-topped inflorescence. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are usually lance-shaped with serrated edges. Native to Europe, it thrives in meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. It is an herbaceous perennial that blooms from late spring to early summer.
